div1.p: Jessie Ames informs Hench that she plans to send more documents to Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Jessie Daniel Ames to Philip Showalter Hench, July 6, 1942
div1.opener:
The Southern Frontier
ISSUED BY
COMMISSION ON INTERRACIAL COOPERATION, INCORPORATED
710 STANDARD BUILDING
ATLANTA, GEORGIA
7/6/42
MRS. JESSIE DANIEL AMES
MANAGING EDITOR
My Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
The four charts are being sent you to-day-
Twenty-one in all- I'll look up my sister-in-
law's address and send it to you tomorrow.
The rest of your letter will take more
time to answer and a bit more composure
than I am possessed of this afternoon-
The portfolio has just come.

I am not surprised that you are going into
the Army and I am glad that I don't know
you personally- It sort of offsets the puzzling
dalliance of the Atlanta doctors.

I hope you will let me know about your
rank and where you will be stationed.
